definition: gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: They run rampant with spyware and viruses.
sentences.chinese: 他们与间谍软件和病毒狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: Hood knew the Empire had spies on Cloud City.
sentences.chinese: 胡德知道云城有帝国间谍。

sentences.english: It has many "holes" that allow spyware to infiltrate your system.
sentences.chinese: 它有很多“洞”可以让间谍软件渗透到你的系统里面。

sentences.english: N. Korea charged U. S. reporters with spying.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜以间谍罪起诉美国记者。

sentences.english: The general infiltrated spies into China.
sentences.chinese: 将军曾派间谍进入中国。

sentences.english: In the first chapter, there is a summary of the espionage and the espionage crime.
sentences.chinese: 第一章是对间谍和间谍犯罪的概括介绍。

sentences.english: In the first chapter, there is a summary of the espionage and the espionage crime.
sentences.chinese: 第一章是对间谍和间谍犯罪的概括介绍。

sentences.english: He was tried because he had acted as a Greman spy during the war.
sentences.chinese: 他因在战争期间充当德国人的间谍而受审。

sentences.english: Spyware is the bane of the home computer user.
sentences.chinese: 间谍软件是家庭电脑用户的致命伤害。

sentences.english: Finally, establishing the international cooperation mechanism of anti-network spy.
sentences.chinese: 最后着手建立防控网络间谍窃密的国际合作机制。

sentences.english: However, the delegation were accused of spying and sent in exile to a desert.
sentences.chinese: 外交团被指间谍，被流放到沙漠。

sentences.english: In diplomatic language, the phrase is normally taken to mean spying.
sentences.chinese: 在外交语言上，这句话的意思通常是指间谍活动。

sentences.english: They were forced to suspend their espionage activities after their identities were compromised.
sentences.chinese: 在身份泄露后，他们被迫搁置了自己的间谍活动。

sentences.english: She believed him, so maybe he would make a good spy, after all.
sentences.chinese: 找出新电影《不可能的任务》令艾米想当间谍的原因。

sentences.english: It was the spy's suspicious manner that first put us on to him.
sentences.chinese: 最初引起我们对这个间谍警惕的是他的可疑的举止。

sentences.english: It engages in espionage and terrorism with Isreal.
sentences.chinese: 它从事对以色列的间谍活动和恐怖主义。

definition: secret service/special service/secret service agent/special agent
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
US Central Intelligence Agency, CIA/abbr. for 中央情報局|中央情报局[Zhong1 yang1 Qing2 bao4 ju2]
to defect/to desert/to betray and flee
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
